ygData.subject: Re: Serialization within HyperNEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey there, The MPI version of HyperNEAT C++ already does this, so you can start there for pointers. Make sure you turn on USE_MPI in the cmake configuration

Hey there,

The MPI version of HyperNEAT C++ already does this, so you can =
start there for pointers. Make sure you turn on USE_MPI in the cmake config=
uration and have MPI installed, and it should work.

--- In neat@yahoogroup=
s.com, "garrerc" <garrerc@...> wrote:
>
> So, I've likely bitten off more t=
han I can chew within a few weeks for my AI class, but it's too late for th=
at now ...
> 
> I'm trying to set up a distributed simulation architecture =
using a centralized server for managing the populations that distribute can=
didate networks to remote hosts to evaluate.  Specifically, I plan on using=
 the candidate networks as neural network controllers for robots within Sta=
ge (sans Player).  I'm totally new to HyperNEAT, so I'm still figuring out =
just how to 1) manage the populations and 2) how to distribute the candidat=
es.  I'm hoping to use the existing Experiment and ExperimentRun classes as=
 examples for 1).  For 2), I'm thinking that I need to somehow take a Genet=
icIndividual, serialize it for transmission to the client simulation and so=
mehow turn it into the network on the client side.  Can I get a few newbie =
pointers on how the process should work?
>
